description.narrative: National Multi-sectoral Nutrition Action Plan rolled-out with monitoring and evaluation framework generating evidence and critical knowledge for informed programming, which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition And Hiv, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2017, UNICEF contributed to a reduction of stunting by 20%, wasting by 20%, anemia by 20% and no increase of overweight through evidenced based policies and equity focused programming, resulting in improved access to quality nutrition services to children and women in UNICEF assisted districts

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National Multi-sectoral Nutrition Action Plan rolled-out with monitoring and evaluation framework generating evidence and critical knowledge for informed programming

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the scale-up of a comprehensive and multi-sectoral data management and monitoring system on nutrition in all 25 districts in the country. This real-time surveillance system enabled improved, real-time child nutrition assessments, including periodic risk factor reviews, and is linked to the national data collection system. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2017
